Yes, Wolverhampton has a number of annual festivals and events that celebrate different aspects of the city's culture. Here are a few examples:

1. Wolverhampton Literature Festival - This festival typically takes place in February and features talks, workshops, and performances by local and national writers.

2. Wolverhampton Comedy Festival - This festival usually takes place in October and features a range of comedy shows and performances by established and up-and-coming comedians.

3. Wolverhampton Fiesta - This is an annual event that takes place in West Park and features live music, food stalls, and fairground rides. The event usually happens in July or August.

4. Wolverhampton Arts Festival - This festival has been running for over 100 years and features competitions and performances across a range of art forms, including music, dance, poetry, and drama.

5. Wolverhampton Pride - This event celebrates LGBTQ+ culture and takes place in the city center. It usually features a parade, live music, and a range of activities and entertainment.

These are just a few examples of the festivals and events that take place in Wolverhampton. Depending on your interests, there may be other events that would appeal to you.
